intro: Miliusa banghoiensis, commonly known as the Banghoi miliusa, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family, which includes cashew and mango. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers. It is typically found in tropical rainforests and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
